1.learning_goal: Foundations of Readable Code: In this unit, students will learn to structure and document programs for clarity by using meaningful names and docstrings, writing purposeful comments, applying consistent formatting, refactoring long scripts into small reusable functions with parameters and returns, using print tracing and invariants to follow and validate program flow, and practicing these skills through hands-on projects and a weekly assessment.

chapters.title: Writing Clear, Self-Explaining Code
chapters.learning_goals: Learn how to make code understandable to others by organizing course concepts, choosing meaningful names for variables and functions, and writing docstrings that clearly explain a function’s purpose and usage. Practice applying these skills to a small “cafe order” program while engaging with peers and instructors through Q&A and reflection.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Welcome to CS101!
lessons.learning_outcomes: Understand the course structure and main topics

lessons.title: Naming that tells a story
lessons.learning_outcomes: Rename variables and functions to improve clarity

lessons.title: Crafting docstrings that explain the why
lessons.learning_outcomes: Write docstrings that explain the purpose and usage of functions

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Cafe order helper
lessons.learning_outcomes: Practice renaming variables/functions and adding clear docstrings so a short “cafe order” script becomes self-explanatory to a new reader.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: Writing Readable, Well‑Commented Code
chapters.learning_goals: Learn to write purposeful comments, apply consistent formatting, and refactor code for instant readability, then practice these skills on a real “weather report” script while using live sessions to clarify questions and reflect on your progress.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Writing comments with real purpose
lessons.learning_outcomes: Add comments that clarify reasoning instead of obvious behavior

lessons.title: Keeping it clean
lessons.learning_outcomes: Apply consistent formatting for whitespace, indentation, and line breaks

lessons.title: Making code instantly readable
lessons.learning_outcomes: Rewrite code to pass a readability checklist

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Weather report formatter
lessons.learning_outcomes: Improve an existing “weather report” script by adding purposeful comments, cleaning formatting, and rewriting sections to be instantly readable.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: Writing Modular, Traceable Programs
chapters.learning_goals: Learn to refactor long, monolithic scripts into small, well-named functions and to use print-based tracing to follow program flow, debug logic, and improve code readability and maintainability.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Turning long scripts into sharp functions
lessons.learning_outcomes: Understand why long monolithic scripts reduce readability, reusability, and maintainability.; Split a long script into focused functions with well-defined signatures.

lessons.title: Following program flow with print tracing
lessons.learning_outcomes: Insert print-based tracing statements to follow program execution

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: To-do list organizer - Part 1
lessons.learning_outcomes: Refactor a long “to-do list organizer” script into small, focused functions with clear names and signatures.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: To-do list organizer - Part 2
lessons.learning_outcomes: Add print-based tracing to the refactored to-do list program to follow program flow and debug logic step by step.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: Reliable and Reusable Code
chapters.learning_goals: In this chapter, students will learn to use invariants as safety checkpoints to ensure program correctness and to redesign logic into modular, reusable functions using parameters and return values. Through a budget tracker project and live Q&A, they will practice enforcing assumptions in code and structuring functions that can be applied in varied scenarios.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Using invariants as safety checkpoints
lessons.learning_outcomes: Understand how invariants help ensure program correctness and prevent bugs.; Apply invariants to check assumptions at key points in the code.

lessons.title: Designing functions that can be reused anywhere
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use parameters and return values to ensure modular function design

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Budget tracker - Part 1
lessons.learning_outcomes: Add invariants to a simple “budget tracker” program to enforce assumptions about balances, transactions, and categories.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Budget tracker - Part 2
lessons.learning_outcomes: Redesign budget-related logic into reusable functions with parameters and return values so the code can be reused in new budgeting scenarios.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: Weekly Review
chapters.learning_goals: Review key concepts learned during the week and complete the weekly assessment.

lessons.title: Weekly Review Prep Session
lessons.learning_outcomes: We'll review key concepts and prepare for the assessment

lessons.title: Weekly Review Assessment
lessons.learning_outcomes: Our weekly assessment, where you will test your knowledge from the last week using practical questions and challenges

2.learning_goal: Professional Problem-Solving Foundations: In this unit, students will strengthen their professional coding habits by defining clear input/output boundaries, validating inputs and handling errors, using tests to safely refactor code, and planning solutions with structured pseudocode that can be reliably translated into working programs.

chapters.title: Defensive Programming & Error Handling
chapters.learning_goals: Learn to define clear input and output boundaries, validate user inputs, and design tests for edge cases so programs behave reliably. Practice crafting meaningful error messages and handling invalid inputs gracefully through a ticket booking validator exercise and interactive Q&A sessions.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Pushing the limits
lessons.learning_outcomes: Understand how clear input and output boundaries ensure reliable, predictable program behavior.; Design and implement tests that verify code correctness at boundary and edge conditions.

lessons.title: Validating inputs before they break things
lessons.learning_outcomes: Implement input validation to prevent unexpected behavior

lessons.title: The art of a well-placed error
lessons.learning_outcomes: Write clear error messages and handle invalid inputs gracefully

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Ticket booking validator
lessons.learning_outcomes: Practice defining clear input/output boundaries, validating user input, and returning helpful error messages for a simple ticket booking flow.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: Refactoring with Confidence
chapters.learning_goals: In this chapter, students will learn to safely refactor code using tests as a safety net, ensuring nothing breaks while improving structure and readability. They will also reflect on and apply professional coding practices to their own projects through guided practice and live discussion.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Refactoring with confidence
lessons.learning_outcomes: Perform safe refactoring moves such as renaming, extracting functions, and removing dead code

lessons.title: Making sure nothing breaks
lessons.learning_outcomes: Re-run tests to confirm consistent behavior after refactoring

lessons.title: Weekly review: professional coding practices
lessons.learning_outcomes: Summarize key professional coding practices covered in the week; Reflect on how to apply these practices in future coding projects

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: To-do list refactor
lessons.learning_outcomes: Practice safely refactoring a small to-do list program while relying on tests to ensure behavior stays the same and reflecting on professional coding habits used.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: From Planning to Pseudocode
chapters.learning_goals: Learn to balance upfront planning with immediate coding, and to systematically break problems into clear, ordered pseudocode steps. Practice refining and reorganizing pseudocode so it closely mirrors executable code, while using live sessions to clarify concepts and ask questions.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Balancing planning and coding
lessons.learning_outcomes: Explain trade-offs between planning and immediate coding

lessons.title: Breaking the problem
lessons.learning_outcomes: Break down a problem into ordered pseudocode steps

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Recipe planner pseudocode - Part 1
lessons.learning_outcomes: Practice weighing planning versus immediate coding while breaking a recipe-planning problem into clear, ordered pseudocode steps.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Recipe planner pseudocode - Part 2
lessons.learning_outcomes: Practice refining and reorganizing your recipe-planning pseudocode to make the steps more precise, ordered, and ready to translate into code.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: From Rules to Pseudocode and Code
chapters.learning_goals: Learn to express real-world rules as clear, hierarchical pseudocode and then translate that pseudocode into consistent, rule-based code actions, using a library checkout system as the main practice context, while engaging in live Q&A and reflection.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Hierarchy in pseudocode
lessons.learning_outcomes: Apply numbering and indentation to represent sequence and hierarchy in pseudocode

lessons.title: Turning rules into code
lessons.learning_outcomes: Translate rules into consistent code actions

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Library checkout rules - Part 1
lessons.learning_outcomes: Practice writing hierarchical, numbered, and indented pseudocode that captures the rules of a library book checkout process.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Library checkout rules - Part 2
lessons.learning_outcomes: Practice translating structured pseudocode rules for a library checkout system into consistent, rule-based code actions.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: Weekly Review
chapters.learning_goals: Review key concepts learned during the week and complete the weekly assessment.

lessons.title: Weekly Review Prep Session
lessons.learning_outcomes: We'll review key concepts and prepare for the assessment

lessons.title: Weekly Review Assessment
lessons.learning_outcomes: Our weekly assessment, where you will test your knowledge from the last week using practical questions and challenges

3.learning_goal: From Plan to App: In this unit, students will learn to translate pseudocode into well-structured, commented Python programs, design and refine function-based solutions incrementally using stubs and test tables, dry run and validate logic before coding, integrate inputs, processing, and outputs into cohesive apps, and demonstrate and reflect on their full process from initial idea to working, tested application.

chapters.title: From Plan to Python
chapters.learning_goals: In this chapter, students will learn to refine pseudocode plans, translate them step by step into working Python programs, and preserve clear comment structures that map code back to the original plan. They will also strengthen their ability to ask targeted questions, review logic for gaps or overlaps, and collaboratively clarify concepts with peers and instructors.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Reviewing the plan
lessons.learning_outcomes: Identify logical gaps or overlaps in pseudocode

lessons.title: From plan to working machine
lessons.learning_outcomes: Translate pseudocode into working Python code step by step

lessons.title: Keeping comments that connect to pseudocode
lessons.learning_outcomes: Maintain comments that connect code to pseudocode blocks

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Cafe order helper
lessons.learning_outcomes: Translate a commented pseudocode plan into clear, working Python code while preserving comments that map directly to each pseudocode block.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: Incremental Program Design
chapters.learning_goals: Learn to design programs by first planning structure with function stubs, then implementing and refining them incrementally using hardcoded placeholders and test tables, while using live Q&A and a practice project to clarify concepts and verify correctness.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Creating function stubs for structure
lessons.learning_outcomes: Write function stubs that define intended structure

lessons.title: Building code incrementally
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use hardcoded return values as placeholders; Replace stubs with working implementations incrementally

lessons.title: Creating test tables for pseudocode plans
lessons.learning_outcomes: Build input-output test tables for pseudocode plans

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Movie night planner
lessons.learning_outcomes: Design function stubs, use placeholder return values, and build a simple planner incrementally while using a test table to guide and verify implementation.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: Building and Validating Complete Apps
chapters.learning_goals: In this chapter, students will learn how to dry run their logic with test tables, then integrate validated inputs, core logic, and formatted outputs into a cohesive Python app. They will apply this process to a budget tracker project and refine their understanding through live Q&A and a closing reflection session.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Dry running plans with test values
lessons.learning_outcomes: Perform dry runs using pseudocode test-table values

lessons.title: Integrating logic into a full app
lessons.learning_outcomes: Integrate validated inputs, logic, and output formatting into one app

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Budget tracker - Part 1
lessons.learning_outcomes: Use a test table to dry run pseudocode for a budget tracker and confirm that the planned logic matches expected inputs and outputs before coding.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Budget tracker - Part 2
lessons.learning_outcomes: Integrate validated inputs, core budget logic, and formatted summaries into one cohesive Python app based on the dry-run plan.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: From Ideas to Working Apps
chapters.learning_goals: In this chapter, students will practice taking an idea from initial concept through planning, pseudocode, and implementation into a working app, using test cases to validate behavior. They will also reflect on their development process to identify personal strengths and areas for improvement, while engaging with peers and instructors through Q&A and review sessions.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Demonstrating the working app
lessons.learning_outcomes: Demonstrate working apps with multiple test cases

lessons.title: Weekly review: from ideas to instructions
lessons.learning_outcomes: Summarize the process of moving from ideas to detailed instructions and working code; Evaluate personal strengths and areas for improvement in planning and implementation

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Fitness log app - Part 1
lessons.learning_outcomes: Demonstrate a working fitness log app using multiple test cases and document how each case flows through the code.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Fitness log app - Part 2
lessons.learning_outcomes: Reflect on the full journey from idea to pseudocode to working code for the fitness log app and identify personal strengths and improvement areas in planning and implementation.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: Weekly Review
chapters.learning_goals: Review key concepts learned during the week and complete the weekly assessment.

lessons.title: Weekly Review Prep Session
lessons.learning_outcomes: We'll review key concepts and prepare for the assessment

lessons.title: Weekly Review Assessment
lessons.learning_outcomes: Our weekly assessment, where you will test your knowledge from the last week using practical questions and challenges

4.learning_goal: Problem Decomposition & Pipelines: In this unit, students will learn to write structured problem statements with clear success criteria, define and sequence subproblems with precise inputs and outputs, match subproblems to common coding patterns while prioritizing tasks by impact and dependencies, and assemble functions into end-to-end data-processing pipelines for real-world case studies.

chapters.title: Problem Decomposition and Specification
chapters.learning_goals: In this chapter, students will learn to turn ideas into clear, structured Python problem statements with concrete success criteria, example inputs/outputs (including edge cases), and well-defined subproblems. They will practice these skills through a guided “movie night planner” exercise and live Q&A sessions.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Writing a structured problem statement
lessons.learning_outcomes: Create structured Python problem statements with success criteria

lessons.title: Defining example inputs and outputs
lessons.learning_outcomes: Provide example inputs and outputs for normal and edge cases

lessons.title: Breaking down into subproblems
lessons.learning_outcomes: Decompose problems into subproblems

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Movie night planner
lessons.learning_outcomes: Practice writing a structured problem statement, defining example inputs/outputs (including edge cases), and breaking the problem into clear subproblems for a simple “movie night planner” app.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: Decomposing and Sequencing Problems
chapters.learning_goals: Learn to break down a larger task into well-defined subproblems with clear inputs and outputs, then arrange those subproblems into a logical, implementable sequence—applying these skills to a realistic cafe cashier checkout workflow.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Defining subproblem inputs and outputs
lessons.learning_outcomes: Define clear inputs and outputs for subproblems

lessons.title: Sequencing subproblems logically
lessons.learning_outcomes: Arrange and implement subproblems in logical sequence

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Cafe cashier - Part 1
lessons.learning_outcomes: Define precise inputs and outputs for each subproblem in a cafe cashier checkout flow, including handling discounts, tax, and edge cases.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Cafe cashier - Part 2
lessons.learning_outcomes: Sequence the previously defined subproblems into a logical, step-by-step process that can be implemented as a complete checkout workflow.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: Pattern‑Driven Planning
chapters.learning_goals: Learn to break problems into subproblems, match them to common coding patterns, and apply clear prioritization criteria (impact, dependencies, risk, effort) to plan and sequence work effectively. Build confidence discussing and justifying implementation and prioritization decisions through guided practice and live Q&A.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Matching subproblems to patterns
lessons.learning_outcomes: Apply common coding patterns to subproblems

lessons.title: Prioritizing tasks
lessons.learning_outcomes: Understand how task prioritization creates an efficient workflow that advances goals by importance and impact.; Demonstrate and explain the rationale for prioritization decisions using clear criteria like impact, dependencies, risk, and effort.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Task scheduler
lessons.learning_outcomes: Match subproblems in a simple task scheduler to common coding patterns (loops, conditionals, accumulators, lookups) and justify those choices.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Feature roadmap planner
lessons.learning_outcomes: Prioritize a list of potential app features using clear criteria (impact, dependencies, risk, effort) and explain the rationale for the chosen order.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.title: Building Data Pipelines from Case Studies
chapters.learning_goals: Learn to decompose real-world problems into smaller functional components and assemble them into end-to-end data-processing pipelines. Practice this process through a fitness tracker case study, moving from raw data to cleaned, analyzed, and summarized outputs, while using live sessions to clarify concepts and ask questions.

lessons.title: Opening session and Q&A
lessons.learning_outcomes: Ask questions, clarify concepts, and engage with instructors and peers in real-time.

lessons.title: Assembling functions into pipelines
lessons.learning_outcomes: Combine functions into pipelines where outputs feed subsequent inputs

lessons.title: Breaking down a case study
lessons.learning_outcomes: Decompose a real-world case study into subproblems

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Fitness tracker pipeline - Part 1
lessons.learning_outcomes: Break down a fitness tracker case study into subproblems and design functions whose outputs can feed into each other as a data-processing pipeline.

lessons.title: Practice Lesson: Fitness tracker pipeline - Part 2
lessons.learning_outcomes: Assemble the defined functions into a working pipeline that processes raw workout data through cleaning, analysis, and summary reporting steps.

lessons.title: Closing session
lessons.learning_outcomes: Wrap up the day togeher with your peers and ask final questions

chapters.learning_goals: Review key concepts learned during the week and complete the weekly assessment.

lessons.title: Weekly Review Prep Session
lessons.learning_outcomes: We'll review key concepts and prepare for the assessment

lessons.learning_outcomes: Our weekly assessment, where you will test your knowledge from the last week using practical questions and challenges
